Reviews.Title: Easy P&S; camera to use
Reviews.Author: The WB
Reviews.Content: I happened across this camera while searching for a small P&S; camera that I could take anywhere.  There are times a cell phone camera cannot do the job properly.  Having used this camera for 4 months and taken several thousand pictures, here is what I have experienced:Good:* 2 AA battery power -- if they die, obtaining suitable replacements is very easy.* Using AA NiMH batteries -- I get about 300 pictures per set of 2,300 mAh batteries.* 10.1 MP sensor - 4:3 is default resolution ratio, but it has the capability of shooting 3:2 (at 9 MP size).* 1/2.33" CCD sensor - quite standard* 5X optical zoom - Equivalent to 35 MM to 175 MM.* Macro mode with focus down to 3"* Live histogram, but has to be turned on each time the camera is powered up* SD and SDHC card capacity - I've used up to a 4 GB SDHC card with no problems.* Mini-USB cable (nonstandard) connection for picture transfer.* Three light meter modes -- Spot, center weighted and AiAE (a complex full frame evaluation mode).The Bad:* Close distance flash shots wash out the subject -- in camera metering of the flash is bad.* Transferring more than 50 pictures at a time via USB cable will cause the camera to crash.* A rectangular shutter button that is a bit stiff to operate at times.* Spot metering tends to wash out pictures.  The best mode is AiAE (complex metering)* The histogram cannot be programed to remain on all the time* EV setting is a bit tedious -- the effect takes once the EV choice has turned off.  It must be restarted each time you want to make an exposure adjustment* The LCD lighting on auto mode tends to show the preview exposure too dark, when, in fact, the exposure is quite good.* Awkward placement of the zoom rocker switch* Framing grid lines are a mid-gray color and are hard to see in sunny conditions.  No provision to change the color.I wrote Customer Service regarding the histogram and grid line issues.  Within 24 hours, they responded.  There is no provision to change the default programing of features on this camera.  They suggested a firmware update, but for this model, GE posted Version 1.10 on the support website.  I have Version 1.11 on my camera.My real test was on a cross-country trip this past April, where I took this camera, a Canon A590 and a Fujifilm S100FS.  The pictures taken with the GE were sharp and clear, when they were outside and in AiAE metering mode.  Taking pictures in landscape mode was a mixed bag - greens were overblown and reds were suppressed.Also, this is an economical P&S; camera.  Don't expect perfect live action shots, unless you crank up the ISO speed to the point the pictures are all grainy.  I learned to keep this camera at ISO 100 for the vast majority of my pictures.  There is an automatic scene detection mode that works, but it too is a mixed bag.  I've shot outdoor pictures of plants in bright sunlight and had the camera turn on the flash as if it was in Sunset mode and backlit subject.  Go figure.Facial recognition works good for this price camera.  Two faces are easily recognized.  When taking flash pictures of people, be careful.  If you are too close, the flash will wash out the persons face.  The metering system and the flash output appear to be separate, so there is no TTL metering of the flash to limit the flash output.  Also. red eye reduction shooting fires 4 times before the image is captured.  The subjects (especially small children) close their eyes and you get a blink picture.  Children mode completely suppresses the flash altogether.The long and the short of it, I found the best mode to shoot in was pure manual mode, where I can set everything (with the aid of the histogram) in AiAE metering mode to capture the correct exposure.  It worked just fine with good tonal reproduction in the final product.  I'm posting some sample pictures with this review.  They represent a cross section of my experiences.CS is responsive, unlike other companies out there.  Build quality is good, but don't expect it to hold up to pure torture.  Overall, for the price I paid, the features and the picture quality, I happened upon a good camera.*****11/19/2010 - UpdateI have used this camera now for just over 7 months and have taken about 3,000 pictures.  If you work with this camera in manual mode with white balance and the histogram to set the exposure, you get some really good results.Battery life is great, even when using the flash.  The NiMH "AA" batteries I have nets me about 300 pictures per set of two, more than enough for a decent day's shoot.The only real complaint I have is with the Auto Focus -- if you push this camera, especially when it is really bright outside, the AF will not set properly.  You have to wait for the on-screen focus indicator to turn green before you take the picture, or it will be blurred.  This camera fires as soon as the shutter is fully depressed regardless of focus.*****7/7/2011 - Update7(+) more months have passed and this camera is still going strong.  I have lost count as to how many pictures have been taken, but I can say "a whole lot."  I don't take this camera with me to as many places as I use to in the past since I purchased an iPhone 4.  For a cell phone with a fixed focal length lens, it takes some real good quality pictures, in the right lighting conditions.In other reviews of this camera, people have complained about this camera being 1) a battery eater and 2) blurry images. Let me try to help clarify these two criticisms with possible solutions.1) Having two A1050 GE cameras (one for me and the other for my son's girlfriend) we have not experienced this issue.  On average, with mixed flash and non-flash pictures, we get about 300 pictures per charged set of two AA batteries.  Why do we have get so many pictures out of a set of batteries?  We exclusively use rechargeable Energizer (the old Everyready Battery Co) Nickel Metal Hydride (NiMH) 2,300 or 2,450 mAh "AA" batteries.  I have used Duracell NiMH and cheaper, no name NiMH batteries with horrible results in this and other digital camera's. Through trial and error over the years using and owning several different "AA" powered digital camera's, I can only recommend Energizer's with any confidence.  I sound like a crummy commercial, but this continues to be my experience.  Energizer's will perform for the long haul and recharge quickly with a good quality rapid battery charger.One more point, I use "AA" alkaline batteries only in a pinch when I absolutely need to keep shooting and fresh rechargeable's are not with me.  This camera and other "AA" cameras (like my wife's Canon Powershot A590) will eat alkaline batteries right up -- with or without the flash being used.  Using alkaline batteries exclusively will give you horrible battery performance that is unfairly reflected in this and any other "AA" battery powered camera.2) Blurry pictures.  Image stabilization in digital cameras is accomplished by two different methods.  The first method uses a motor/gyroscope setup that either shifts the lens or light sensor element or both to reduce shake/blur.  Whereas the second method automatically increases the ISO (film speed) of the camera to a faster shutter time and thereby reducing the chance of shake/blur.  This camera uses the second method -- Auto ISO increasing for stabilization.  While the ISO increase method sounds good, it is far from perfect.  Higher ISO settings produce an unwanted grain effect, especially when it is dark, sometimes to the point that the picture looks absolutely horrible, even when the camera is in perfect focus.  Classic case is an outdoor concert at night.  At full size on a computer, the picture is blotchy and unclear.I also do not like the GE's slow flash sync (1/30th of a second sync).  Pictures with motion using flash are often times blurry.  My Fujifilm S100FS stock flash syncs at a minimum of 1/60th and most times at 1/128th of a second.  At 1/128th of a second sync, this is truly stop motion with almost no blur.  Long flash sync time is a weakness in this camera.Also, as I commented earlier regarding the auto focus of this camera, you have to wait until this camera signals the subject is in focus.  Green brackets will appear either in the center of the picture, if face detection is turned off or around the faces of your subjects, if face detection is turned on.  It may take several half depressions of the shutter button to get the camera to properly focus and signal that the focus is correct, especially when it is really bright outside.  This GE camera will take the picture if you fully depress the shutter button regardless of focus.  You cannot push this camera to instantly focus on a subject and expect it to take a tack sharp picture each and every time.  Again, this is another limitation of this camera.*****12/21/2011 - UpdateStill going strong.  Took over 200 pictures this past November during hunting season in NW Michigan -- all came out great.  What can I say, for a small P&S; camera, you cannot beat it.Amazon now has a second supplier for this model camera found as GE A Series 10.1-Megapixel Digital Camera - Black/Silver A1050BK-CP.  This is the very same camera as described above.  Check it out.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pocket shooter
Reviews.Author: T. McAtee "Tech nut"
Reviews.Content: Great zoom capacity, Excellent photo quality, Huge storage capability, Easy operation, Great price and warranty.What else needs to be said. This is an excellent point and shoot camera for any user.I had some misgivings when ordering, thinking "How good can it be? It's nearest feature competitor is priced well over $150". No regrets, and that doesn't happen very often in my experience.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera to carry around
Reviews.Author: violinsolo "violinsolo"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera that would be easy to carry around on short trips. But I also had some basic requirements: decent resolution and optical zoom (at least 5x), the use of AA batteries, and a price within $100. Most of the latest thin cameras use proprietary lithium-ion batteries, but these need re-charging and if you run out of power on the go, you are stuck. It is easier to simply pop into any local store in the world and buy a few AA batteries.The GE A1050 is great for me, as it fits the above bill very nicely. Granted it is not as thin as other models, but this unit still fits easily in my shirt pocket and does not weigh it down. The picture quality is great and the video mode is also handy when I do not have my more bulky camcorder with me. Photos are sharp and print very well. Nice LCD screen size too.I am yet to explore any settings beyond the typical ones accessed via the external buttons. Overall, a very good general-purpose point-and-shoot device. I was slightly skeptical about the GE brand for cameras, but I believe they have done well with this model.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it appears
Reviews.Author: Richard Widman "Richard"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter to take pictures of her twins, but she has given it back. The zoom is good, but there are two critical points that make it not very usable for taking pictures of young children or anything moving. Maybe ok for scenery with caution and small fingers.1st is that the little button to take the picture is small and flat, causing you to accidentally move the camera when you push it, giving a blurry image.2nd is that it takes too long to take and save the picture, to you want to take a second shot and it can't since it is apparently still saving the first one. This results in many missed shots.My daughter went back to her old Sony, My wife prefers her older Sony, and I prefer my Samsung. I'll re-sell this one.

Reviews.Title: Great vid, great size, nice pics ... if you stand perfectly still.
Reviews.Author: Justin Wright "Justin"
Reviews.Content: I recently got this camera for Christmas, in silver however, the video comes out great. You can narrate your pictures with audio clips with the internal microphone also. Takes great pictures when your still and in adequate light right out the box. For the more difficult low light and pictures while moving, it doesn't do so great.It list image stabilization, however a lot of pictures still end up blurry. You just to give the camera time to focus itself.So, when you use it just standing still press the button in a little let the camera focus til you like the picture then mash it it and you get a great picture. Otherwise, it might be out of focus.Video is great! Better quality video then my flip and a nice upgrade over my 5 megapixel camera.While the lens cover seems flimsy, it serves it function and gets out of the way I turn on the camera and snaps shut when I am finished. So far, no problems 26 days in.For the price, you'll do very well especially if you do pocket cam corder video. For pictures, just make sure you stand very still before you shoot.

Reviews.Title: Excellant value and good camera
Reviews.Author: T. Waters
Reviews.Content: If you want to pay double you can get something only a little better.  I gave this to my Mom and it works great as a pocket camera for family and vacation pics.  The blink detection works good, good battery life.

Reviews.Title: GREAT DEAL
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Cat "Patient Advocate"
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of days researching cameras for my 20yo daughter & couldn't believe the price on this one with all the features it offers. She's taken a good bit of pics with it now and no complaints. She loads her pics to her PC w/o problems (and I think she figured a way to do it w/o the cord!).I really liked that it has internally memory for those days you forget the memory card. Also uses regular batteries, which is nice if you battery dies while on a trip.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Christy J. Langston "Rykio"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a smaller camera that I could carry it around in my pocket or purse without too much worry. Now, this is not a point and click camera. I am totally satisfied with my Canon Powershot 12 megapixel camera but it takes up a lot of room in my purse and I rely on a case to carry it. This takes clear pictures and is a lot like my other camera. I never knew GE made cameras but this one is excellent and the price is great. If you take a lot of pictures and are camera friendly this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Barb
Reviews.Content: Reviewed digital cameras for ease of operation and size.  Found this GE and the price was terrific.  I am thrilled with the camera so far.  Photos are great, has the stabilization option, can do movies and panoramic...I haven't found anything that I do not like so far.  Great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: like the select wheel (fast), solid quality
Reviews.Author: bellavida369
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything I want- movie mode w/ sound and image stabilization, 10 MP for stills if I feel like making large prints, and large LCD screen.The Fuji AX-200 also seemed very good and offered HD (720) @ 24 FPS, the GE has 640 x 480 @ 30 FPS. Both have 5X optical lens image stabilization, neither dropped audio while zooming, but both 'stepped' the zoom while recording- the GE 'stepped' less though- maybe the video capability of these probably won't be what a camcorder can offer, but it is there for convenience. The Fuji video specs out an HD resolution, though not at 30 FPS, the GE does well in low light and I am surprised how well it holds up even on a 32" standard def TV-The select wheel on the GE I found faster to use than the menu system on the Fuji, at least for me.  Both run on AA batteries, and are nice, solid cameras though.

Reviews.Title: Avoid this camera!
Reviews.Author: Stacie C. Buckland "-cRaSh"
Reviews.Content: I love to take pictures as a hobby, but wanted something smaller then my Fujifilm camera to take family snap shots and to have in my purse, for those spur of the moment shots.  The sad thing, you cannot take any decent pictures with this camera unless it's outside, and the subject is PERFECTLY STILL!  Any action at all, in any mode, will cause a blur.I really wanted to like this camera because of all the (surprising) good reviews.  The size is nice, battery life, not bad.  Very simple and fast to upload pictures.  The color is almost always terrible, indoors, high in yellow color.I wanted a deal, but the fact is, if you want decent pictures, and not settle for bad color and blurred photos, you'll spend $30-$100 more and get a better camera.  If you want to shoot some outdoor shots, like flowers, then this will suffice.

Reviews.Title: Bad battery life
Reviews.Author: HNoelle88
Reviews.Content: The quality of the images are nice, but I'm always changing the batteries!!! The battery life isn't good on this camera!!!! It's actually pretty terrible, and I've had A LOT of cameras!!!!

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Richard Baxter
Reviews.Content: I studied the subject of <$100 point & shoots waaay too hard.  This is perfect & the price is right.  The only complaint is that I can't figure out how to give Worldwide Dist 5 stars also.  Delivered as perfectly as I could hope for.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Lee Baltzell
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Worth the price I paid <$50. The flash is a bit strong and washes out some colour. Easy to use.I have not printed any pictures from it yet, but have downloaded them and the pictures look really nice on the computer. The zoom is great. Still getting used to doing some of the finer things on the camera (things besides just point and click). The screen is a good size.

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: 5starguy12
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement to my 5mp camera. it has many features, and is easy to use. it has a long battery life, and its smaller than my old one. takes great pictures in low light conditions i haven't tried taking videos yet. another feature i like is the time lapse feature, i didn't realize it had it until i bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great budget friendly digital camera!
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Really nice camera at a good price. I doubt a professional photographer would use it but for family activities and day to day life, it works great. Only down side is it doesn't come with a memory card but you can pick those up for a dime a dozen anymore. All in all, good value and pruchase.

Reviews.Title: Excelent¡¡¡
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, takes very pretty photos, the shipment I arrive anters from the considered thing for the delivery. really between this and the Lumix, I remain with this.

Reviews.Title: GE makes digital cameras??
Reviews.Author: Stan Grabowski
Reviews.Content: I never knew G.E. made digital cameras! I IS A NICE CAMERA AND SHOOTS WELL IN LOW LIGHT.THE COLOUR IS SORT OF BRIGHT ALTHOUGH THAT MAKES IT EASY TO FIND THE CAMERA WHEN YOUARE LOOKING FOR IT.

Reviews.Title: The John Q Public camera
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: This is aslightly dated camera that provides all the features and quality that  a common traveller needs while carrying a modest cost.  Really, how many of us need to think we are professional photographers!  This does it for under $40.

Reviews.Title: Easy to figure out.
Reviews.Author: Annette H.
Reviews.Content: After buying several different cameras for my daughter, I was beginning to believe there were no decent cameras out there at a rate that I could afford. We had returned several that wouldn't even take a single picture or video.This one, however, was even better than we expected. Easy to figure out.

Reviews.Title: Good all around camera
Reviews.Author: irishhandyman "There is no such thing as a pr...
Reviews.Content: After taking over 1500 pictures and putting the camera into all kinds of situations I have to say it is a good camera.  With my job I can go from being under a house to up in the attic.  Dust, moisture, and even being dropped a couple of times hasn't seemed to hurt it at all.I like the fact it has a HDMI output.  It lets me hook the camera to the homeowners tv to show them exactly what or where a problem is.  The rechargeable battery is a plus as well.  No more carrying around a brick of AA batteries.  Picture quality is good.  Bang for the buck you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: good cam
Reviews.Author: peaxchy1029
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a bday gift for my mom & she loves it. Very easy to use, takes a nice picture especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: bonbon
Reviews.Content: What can I say,your product is wonderfulI love the camera,and it does everything I want.Great price,but everything we have gotten from Amazonhas been great.We bought a 52 in TV about 4yrs agoit is great too. Thank you Bonnie Smith!

Reviews.Title: Camera is ok
Reviews.Author: willg
Reviews.Content: My daughter have had trouble tryin to get good pic's. Some come out ok and the others are just blurred.

Reviews.Title: Nice cheap camera
Reviews.Author: Matty12
Reviews.Content: Really good camera for the price.  Takes nice pictures, and the panorama feature works well and is very easy to use.  The only negative is the the color seems to be a little washed out in the pictures, but that can be easily fixed with a photo program.

Reviews.Title: Inconsistent Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Frequent Clicker
Reviews.Content: I was unsure about 2 or 3 stars overall, but went ahead and gave it 3.  When the camera takes a good picture, the quality is pretty good.  But randomly pictures will be blurry.  I found myself shooting way more pictures than I was planning to- just to make sure there would be a few that would turn out clear.  Many times, I would have to delete many more than I kept.  Some would look clear on the lcd screen, but after loading them to my pc I would find out they were blurry.  My first A1050 had a factory lcd screen defect.  GE was great to deal with.  They sent me a new camera to replace it- I didn't even have to pay postage.  But I noticed that both cameras had this same issue of inconsistent picture quality.  When a picture turned out clear, it was good.  Getting that to happen was a bit of a mystery for me.  I have since bought a different camera (another brand) and am better pleased.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, bad flash.
Reviews.Author: Brock
Reviews.Content: I like the camera. It takes quality photos and has some good features for the price. Buy good batteries. My only complaint is that the flash washes out the picture, making nearly useless. I wish there was a way to turn it down.

Reviews.Title: The Price Is Right!
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Strange Jr.
Reviews.Content: This camera is good not excellent, but It is great for the price I paid. The service is great and the product arrived on time.When I first got it, I started to compared it to other cameras I've had and found myself disappointed, but then I was reminded that my last camera (Kodak EasyShare Z885) was sold NEW for $300 and much better condition and quality and it really wasn't fair to compare them - This one was refurbished and sold for $50 even NEW it's sold for $200.It grew on me after that. I can't do everything I want with it, I'm a bit limited, but for the price I paid, you really couldn't ask for a better camera.I wouldn't buy it New. I'd probably opt to wait for another $100 and get the Kodak EasyShare Z885.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Jocko De Paris
Reviews.Content: Great, powerful camera.  Easy on batteries.  Simply take out of box, and point and shoot.  It can't get any easier than that.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Javi
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Not that great picture quality or camera, but not bad for $60+ I paid. Has this dark spot in the LCD screen towards the middle (not sure if it's the camera lens or screen). Oh well....

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive - you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Steve Ackley
Reviews.Content: I had been in the market for a new camera for almost a year, and while doing my homework I found this one. I immediately liked the 5x optical zoom feature and the 2.5 inch display, and for the price I thought I was getting a great deal since cameras with comparable features were at least double the price. I read all the reviews and comments about this camera, both on Amazon and other websites, but decided that the low price outweighed the possible fuzziness in some of the pictures.I was delighted that I received it from Amazon a bit earlier than I expected, but when I started using it, I found some of the features were disappointing. Two in particular, low light and zooms, were unforgivably blurry. One comment suggested waiting for the camera to focus; I did, but it was still blurry.As it stands, for me this isn't exactly a point and shoot camera - there's a little homework that needs to be done in order for this camera to be usable.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service saved the day
Reviews.Author: Pamela Rojo "pamrojo"
Reviews.Content: In order to full give credit where credit is due - this opinion is ALL about customer service and not about the item I ordered.  I ordered a GE A1050 digital camera. I received a GE J1050. The difference was the J model has a square battery that charges inside the battery. The A model (which I wanted) uses regular AAA batteries that can be recharged outside the camera. The square battery for the J model cost $20! So - either you pay another $20 to get a spare battery recharged if you think you'll need additional battery power or you'll have to stop taking pictures until you recharge the one battery you do have. When I notified customer service of the mistake of sending me a J model camera instead of an A model they explained they were out of the A model and since they knew I needed a camera post haste (mine had been stolen on a trip) they sent the 'upgraded J model at no extra charge.'  I explained I didn't want the J model because of the battery. I didn't want a battery that had to be recharged inside the camera.  They tried to find me an A model through other vendors even though they weren't going to get anything out of the transaction and, in fact, lost money because they sent me a return label to send the camera back to them. I was notified by Amazon that credit had been given to my account within 7 days of sending the camera back.  Another thing customer service did for me - they told me to go ahead and use the J model camera until I got the label to send it back.  I was glad to try the camera out - only something was wrong - either the battery was defective or the camera was. I charged the battery pursuant to instructions and the camera never would come on. I tried several times to charge the battery so I don't know what was wrong - whether it was the camera or the battery but that solidified my decision not to accept the J model.  I just can't say enough about customer service though. They were GREAT. They sent me several emails concerning questions I had about the camera.  They tried to accommodate me at every turn.  I apologize for not sending this rating sooner but I had to have emergency surgery and have just gotten to the point I can sit at a computer.  Thanks again for trying to help me with this purchase.  I don't think I'll be buying another GE camera though.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good but basic digital camera
Reviews.Author: Misha
Reviews.Content: I bought it over three weeks ago and immediately tested it out.  It was pretty good.  It takes some nice pictures however the image stabilization and movie are other problem I'm still trying to adjust.  Image stabilization photos came out very blurry.  Movie...well, when it uploaded to this macbook, it won't open at all.  Sometimes it opened, sometimes it won't or couldn't seem to open. But the rest is very good.  It is good for beginners to novice.Recommend this, I don't know because I'm still learning though even I haven't taken anymore pictures often.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Pictures
Reviews.Author: Jeanne C. Brooks "General User Jeanne"
Reviews.Content: This GE camera is easy to use but 90% of the photos are blurry. On ALL settings, the camera cannot stabilize handling motion. Most pictures are very blurry and ruined. I would not recommend this camera to anyone. I am going to give it to my child as a toy.

ProductInfo.Features:
10MP Digital Camera with 5x optical zoom and 5.7x digital zoom
2.5 Inch vibrant LCD with auto brightness
24 MB internal memory with SD/SDHC card support up to an additional 8 GB
Auto scene, blink, smile and face detection
Uses 2 AA batteries so you'll never be stranded waiting for your camera battery to charge
ProductInfo.Name: GE A1050-RD 10MP Digital Camera with 5X Optical Zoom and 2.5 Inch LCD with Auto Brightness - Red
